1.brief: to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),

a rope (as twisted), especially a measuring line; by implication, a district or inheritance (as measured); or a noose (as of cords); figuratively, a company (as if tied together); also a throe (especially of parturition); also ruin
properly, extension, i.e. height or breadth; also a measure (including its standard); hence a portion (as measured) or a vestment; specifically, tribute (as measured)

2.brief: where?; hence, whither?, when?; also hither and thither
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)
near, with or among; often in general, to
properly, to stretch; by implication, to measure (as if by stretching a line); figuratively, to be extended
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
Jerushalaim or Jerushalem, the capital city of Palestine
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses

3.brief: a messenger; specifically, of God, i.e. an angel (also a prophet, priest or teacher)
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.
a messenger; specifically, of God, i.e. an angel (also a prophet, priest or teacher)
properly, hinder; generally, next, other, etc.
to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.
an encountering, accidental, friendly or hostile (also adverbially, opposite)

4.brief: near, with or among; often in general, to
to run (for whatever reason, especially to rush)
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
near, with or among; often in general, to
(concretely) a boy (as active), from the age of infancy to adolescence; by implication, a servant; also (by interch. of sex), a girl (of similar latitude in age)
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
Jerushalaim or Jerushalem, the capital city of Palestine
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
properly, a dumb beast; especially any large quadruped or animal (often collective)
a bisection, i.e. (by implication) the centre

5.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
(as noun) a circle, neighbour, or environs; but chiefly (as adverb, with or without preposition) around
properly, weight, but only figuratively in a good sense, splendor or copiousness
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
a bisection, i.e. (by implication) the centre

6.brief: to flit, i.e. vanish away (subside, escape; causatively, chase, impel, deliver)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
properly, hidden, i.e. dark; used only of the north as aquarter (gloomy and unknown)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

7.brief: Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem
properly, to be smooth, i.e. (by implication) to escape (as if by slipperiness); causatively, to release or rescue; specifically, to bring forth young, emit sparks
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
a daughter (used in the same wide sense as other terms of relationship, literally and figuratively)
Babel (i.e. Babylon), including Babylonia and the Babylonian empire

8.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, like this, i.e. by implication, (of manner) thus (or so); also (of place) here (or hither); or (of time) now
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a mass of persons (or figuratively, things), especially reg. organized forwar (an army); by implication, a campaign, literally or figuratively (specifically, hardship, worship)
properly, the hind part; generally used as an adverb or conjunction, after (in various senses)
properly, weight, but only figuratively in a good sense, splendor or copiousness
to send away, for, or out (in a great variety of applications)
near, with or among; often in general, to
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
to drop or strip; by implication, to plunder
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)

properly, to touch, i.e. lay the hand upon (for any purpose; euphemistically, to lie with a woman); by implication, to reach (figuratively, to arrive, acquire); violently, to strike (punish, defeat, destroy, etc.)

something hollowed (as a gate), i.e. pupil of the eye
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)

near, with or among; often in general, to

a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)

12.brief: to inherit (as a (figurative) mode of descent), or (generally) to occupy; causatively, to bequeath, or (generally) distribute, instate
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
Jehudah (or Judah), the name of five Israelites; also of the tribe descended from the first, and of its territory

above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a sacred place or thing; rarely abstract, sanctity

properly, iteration or continuance; used only adverbially (with or without preposition), again, repeatedly, still, more
Jerushalaim or Jerushalem, the capital city of Palestine

flesh (from its freshness); by extension, body, person; also (by euphemistically) the pudenda of aman

Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

a sacred place or thing; rarely abstract, sanctity
